required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Novel Dynamic Random-dot Stereopsis Assessment to Measure the Stereopsis in Intermittent Exotropia
clinical_study.official_title: A Novel Dynamic Random-dot Stereopsis Assessment to Measure the Stereopsis in Intermittent Exotropia

lead_sponsor.agency: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

clinical_study.source: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

brief_summary.textblock: A novel dynamic random-dot stereopsis test that included motion + disparity (MD), motion (M), and disparity (D), in which the disparity cues range from 200 to 1200 arc-seconds was used. The characteristics of preoperative dynamic stereopsis in 83 intermittent exotropia patients and its associations with clinical features were analysed, and the prognosis was followed up on the 1st day and 2nd, 6th and 12nd months postoperatively.

primary_outcome.measure: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis
primary_outcome.description: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis on the 1st day

primary_outcome.measure: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis
primary_outcome.description: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis on the 2nd month

primary_outcome.measure: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis
primary_outcome.description: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis on the 6th month

primary_outcome.measure: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis
primary_outcome.description: The mean reciprocal value of stereopsis on the 6th month

clinical_study.condition: Dynamic Stereopsis in Intermittent Exotropia Patients

intervention.description: The characteristics of preoperative dynamic stereopsis in 83 intermittent exotropia patients and its associations with clinical features were analysed, and the prognosis was followed up on the 1st day and 2nd, 6th and 12nd months postoperatively.

study_pop.textblock: A total of 83 cases X(T) patients and 50 normal subjects were enrolled in the study.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, Sun Yat-sen University

patient_data.ipd_description: A novel dynamic random-dot stereopsis test that included motion + disparity (MD), motion (M), and disparity (D), in which the disparity cues range from 200 to 1200 arc-seconds was used. The characteristics of preoperative dynamic stereopsis in 83 intermittent exotropia patients and its associations with clinical features were analysed, and the prognosis was followed up on the 1st day and 2nd, 6th and 12nd months postoperatively.
